attributes.action: Partially refund full-time students and/or provide additional financial support.
attributes.additional_details:
Many UK Universities have and will remain closed for face-to-face learning. The ongoing stress of performing visual learning is not something that students opted to pay for. We feel a partial refund should be in place to compensate for this distress.

Additionally, many students face the predicament whereby necessary student accommodation is being paid for in hope to return to on-campus learning. Many students are worse off due to paying for this inaccessible accommodation and further financial support is therefore vital.
attributes.background: We urge the Government to impose emergency partial refunds across all of the United Kingdom for full time students. We also urge that the Government increase funding available to students.

rejection.details:
We understand you want the Government to refund students fees, however any reimbursement of fees is the responsibility of individual universities not the UK Government or Parliament.

You might therefore wish instead to sign this petition which calls on the Government to require universities to partially refund students: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/550738

You may also wish to sign these petitions relating to other forms of financial support for students:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554299
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/558669

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/
